alert.note: Alert for Brown; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Rock, eastern Brown and central Keya Paha Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 404 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wewela to 12 miles north of Brewster. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Springview, Long Pine, Burton, Hofeld Lake, Nets Peak, Raven, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Jones Lake and Johnsons Corner. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 240 and 258. Highway 12 near mile marker 40, and between mile markers 46 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
